title: How to Identify a Border Collie

steps.title: Notice the dog's size.
steps.content: Notice the dog's size. Border Collies are medium in size. They weigh from 30 to 55 pounds (14 to 25 kg), males standing at 19–22 inches (48–56 cm) tall and females being 18–21 inches (46–53 cm) in height. steps.title: Look at the eyes.
steps.content: Look at the eyes. The eyes of a Border Collie are set well apart. They are of moderate size, oval in shape, and may be any color, though blue eyes in dogs other than merle are not preferred. steps.title: Check the ears.
steps.content: Check the ears. Borders have either erect or semi-erect ears, the latter having tips that fall forward or outward, or may have one of each. The ears are medium in size and are set well apart. [5] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source

steps.title: View the muzzle.
steps.content: View the muzzle. A Border's muzzle is strong and tapers slightly to the nose, with the sides of the head tapering smoothly into the muzzle. The nose is fully pigmented, and Borders have a scissors bite. [6] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club Expert knowledge, resources and advice for all things dog-related. Go to source

steps.title: Inspect the tail.
steps.content: Inspect the tail. Border Collies have moderately long tails that are set on low. The tail is carried low and may have a slight upward swirl at the end when the dog is concentrating and may be raised when the dog is excited. steps.content: Differentiate between coat types. steps.title: Recognize intelligence.
steps.content: Recognize intelligence. Border Collies are thought of by some to be the smartest dog breed. They need ongoing mental stimulation to stay occupied due to their high intelligence, such as canine sports. [16] X Research source

steps.title: See if the dog is athletic.
steps.content: See if the dog is athletic. Borders are very active and athletic dogs. They need at least an hour of exercise daily to meet their high-energy needs. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Take note of alertness.
steps.content: Take note of alertness. Known to be very vigilant and alert, Border Collies always keep an eye on their families. They will also bark to alert their owners of any potential threats. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Expect a herding instinct.
steps.content: Expect a herding instinct. Borders were bred to be herding dogs, so it's only natural to expect a strong herding instinct from one. They may try to herd children, cats, or other animals. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Watch for loyalty.
steps.content: Watch for loyalty. Developing deep bonds with their owners, Border Collies are very loyal dogs. This can make them good family dogs, though they may form an especially close bond with one family member. [21] X Research source
